alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued November 19 at 11:37AM EST until November 19 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.0 to 7.1 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...This could result in some roads becoming impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 12:29 PM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible up to an hour before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 19/01 PM 7.0 1.2 1.2 N/A Minor 20/01 AM 5.7 -0.1 0.7 N/A None 20/02 PM 6.8 1.0 1.1 N/A None 21/02 AM 6.1 0.3 0.9 N/A None 21/03 PM 6.4 0.6 0.7 N/A None 22/03 AM 5.7 -0.1 0.2 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.
